Articles.Content:
I am fully aware that it constitutes cheating to edit a save file, but this is more like a backup restoration that a cheat:

In the process of multi-tasking three ships at once around Jool, I've managed to have both quicksave and persistent save files save the game state where a vessel of mine will be encountering Laythe. The problem with this encounter is that the alignment will be retrograde and with a very unfortunate inclination to be docking with another vessel.

If only I could rewind the game 2 hours before. Does anyone know how to do something like that?

Edited January 16, 2014 by Blue

No, you cannot undo an autosave unless you have a copy of the persistent file from earlier. Sorry.

Also, it's technically not even "cheating" if there are no constraints to make it so. That's best part about this game.
Rewinding time is possible, but not your ship position at that time. Sadly you are probably going to loose that ship.
Hm. I know you can alter the universal time, but I don't know whether that will actually affect anything...
This might help

Sadly you are probably going to loose that ship.

If I can't cheat one way, I'll fudge it another--by doing a highly eccentric orbit, and then hard-burning to change the inclination and angle grade correctly with infinite fuel on.
